constructor.details: Constructor that disables initializers to prevent implementation contract from being initialized

params.targetContract: The address of the target contract

returns.jobId: The ID of the created job

params.jobId: The ID of the job to delete

getJobOwner(uint256).details: Get the owner of a job

returns._0: jobOwner The address of the job owner

getTotalJobsCount().details: Get the total number of jobs created

getUserActiveJobIds(address).details: Get all active job IDs for a user

returns.activeJobIds: Array of active job IDs owned by the user

getUserJobIds(address).details: Get all job IDs for a user

returns.jobIds: Array of job IDs owned by the user

params.initialOwner: The address that will be set as the initial owner

isJobActive(uint256).details: Check if a job is active

returns.isActive: True if the job is active, false otherwise

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.jobId: The ID of the job to update
params.jobType: The old type/category of the job
params.newData: The new additional data for the job
params.newJobName: The new name of the job
params.newTimeFrame: The new timeframe for job execution
params.oldData: The old additional data for the job
params.oldJobName: The old name of the job
params.oldTimeFrame: The old timeframe for job execution
params.targetContract: The old address of the target contract

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.
